messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 60 and above years old, female, of White descent. You have some college education and an annual income of $55,000 - $74,999. English is your first language. You are 1 feet tall and weighs 175-200 lbs pounds.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly. You are someone who I neutral with my thinking style. I am very unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings rarely. I neutral that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts never. I agree that my well-being is good. I strongly agree that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I strongly agree that I am dependable and organized. I agree that I am emotionally stable and calm. I strongly agree that I am open to experience and imaginative.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I understand the basics, and usually tell the dr. to explain in laymans terms. I have no problems with asking more questions if I am not happy with wht the dr tells me
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
he is very free and open to talk to me about just anything I may ask, has my best interests at heart
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
that he may find something wrong with me that may be life altering, and I would have to go for extensive tests or see a specialist, or go out of town to another dr.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
none I CAN THINK OF, DO NOT CARE TO ELABORATE ON ALL MY MEDICAL PROBLEMS AT THIS TIME, I THINK TERE ARE CERTAIN ILLNESSES THAT SHOULD REMAIN PERSONNAL

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have been with the same doctor for about 15 years. I am very comfortable asking him questions about any issues I have. I do not feel like he rushes to get me out of the office. He takes his time and answers my questions. He is thorough in all my health care needs.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my primary care physician very much. He is thorough in my yearly check-ups. I have been seeing the same doctor for 17 years. He is very knowledgeable about my medical history so I am confident in asking questions if I have any.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I think the routine yearly visits do not make me anxious or stressed out. I think if I have to go for something other than a routine visit there is some stress. The stress or anxiety comes from not knowing if there is an issue or what the issue may be. With the diseases in today's society, such as cancer, when you have an unknown health issue there is usually anxiety that comes with it.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had an ultrasound on my uterus. The results came back showing a mass. I had another ultrasound done. I went to the same doctor and then I went for a second opinion. The first doctor told me to wait for six months and we would do another ultrasound to compare. The second doctor talked to me about the image and the mass and suggested surgery. I went to the second doctor.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

As a fully functioning adult with competent medical facility, I feel confident that I have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and to make decisions pertaining to my health/ medical care.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I take everything with a grain of salt. In most situations, I will follow the recommendations of my primary care physician as they typically know what is best, however I also do my own research. Occasionally, if I don't feel my questions have been answered satisfactorily then I will seek a second opinion.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am a generally anxious person and any interaction with a doctor makes me feel uncomfortable. I am uncomfortable with my body and with the shape I am in so that plays into it as well. Mostly, I just feel like a freak and my problems are unusual or like the doctors are judging me and the shape that I am in.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I don't know that such an experience exists as I have very little knowledge of health or medical issues, I only know when I feel something is wrong with my body. An example would be that once I had sudden onset shortness of breath and I knew that was abnormal so instead of waiting to go the doctor, I went immediately and was diagnosed with a massive pulmonary embolism.

I always listen carefully to what the doctor says and ask question when needed .if you have a good doctor that will take the time to explain thing and answer all you concerns and worries if any .
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

i dont have a primary doc I go to a practice that you will see a different doctor every time or a pa nurse practioner  .  at the time I changed doctors I DID NOT LOOK FOR A doctor at the time so I just go to this practice
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
cost and what is wrong if  I HAVE TO LOSE TIME FROM WORK . If there is any more cost for theraphy . this is things I can,t pay for because of the health care cost that are not afordably
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had a stent in my heart when I was 43 years old do to smoking and bad eating habits and stress in my life so I DO KNOW ABOUT HEART decasie runs in my family  . all of my siblings take perventived  medcenie

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I have a problem in that I wear hearing aids. If I am not wearing them, I often have to ask the health care provider to either repeat himself or to repeat what he said.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I have a good amount of trust in my doctor- he seems to have my best interests at heart. He doesnÃ¢ÂÂt rush when he sees or examines me and takes copious notes that are added to my electronic file. He has his staff do follow- ups if he canÃ¢ÂÂt do them himself.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am afraid that a recurrence of a disease might occur. I am also allergic to many antibiotics, so any time that I have an infection, I am afraid that I will have a reaction if I am taking a new antibiotic. It is just a relief when the doctor tells me what the problem is and that it can be easily treated.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was at home, alone, eating soup when I tried to swallow a lentil, but it got caught in my throat. I realized that I was not able to get it to go down and I could  feel it in my throat. I drove to the local fire station and the firefighters took me to the local hospital. After several hours, and a few tests, the attending doctor said there was nothing there. I was admitted, however, and the specialist for stomach problems listened to my story, and did a balloon endoscopy in the late evening. Sure enough, he found the lentil.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel very confident in my ability to communicate my symptoms and concerns to the doctor and then ask questions to clarify my understanding when they give a diagnosis.  I ask a LOT of questions and then I go home and do a little more research online.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My primary care person is a local Nurse Practitioner.  She is busy but never seems rushed while visiting with me about my concerns.  She listens and then asks questions to be sure she understands.  She explains the reason she will chose a certain treatment or why she's choosing to wait and see rather than treat right away.  I like that she doesn't talk down to me and treats me as though I am intelligent enough to understand.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
By the time I get to the doctor I've often thought of all the most terrible things my symptoms could be and though I know the worry is mostly unfounded, I am still anxious until I'm proven wrong.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My husband's cholesterol is high.  We talked to the doctor and then looked up information to see what target number we needed to get him to.  Then we researched on our own and followed information the doctor gave us to determine the changes we could make in our diet and exercise program to help bring his cholesterol down.  We were able to facilitate that change enough in 6 months to avoid needing to have him take medication.

all things in the end are based on the insurance you have or do not have and where you can go to get the care you need

I don't worry about visiting the Drs, some tests are not comfortable but they are needed to make a informed medical decision

being able to call the Dr about a possbile infection my Mom had in a surgrey site and found out I was right

I believe that I can understand what I need to know.  I don't have a problem with information processing.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I haven't had him long but so far he is very caring and listens to what I have to say.  I bring a list of questions when I go and he lets me ask and gives thoughtful answers.  Doesn't blow me off like some.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I don't like shots or blood drawing but I know they are necessary so I endure them.  I know that these are necessary for my overall health.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I can't think of anything.  I do what I need to and don't dwell on medical issues.  I know what I need to know and I ask questions if unsure.

it is just a normal thing to do.  I have never had a reason to not true a doctor with a diagnosis they know what they are doing

when I have a test done I get very worried and anxious while I am setting there waiting to be called back to find the results

when I had a hemmorride surgery I had no clue as to what would happen after so I roled every question immagable at the doctor

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel fairly confident that when I see medical professiols, I am getting the information I need specific to my situation. If there are areas I am unclear on, I try to ask questions to help myself understand. Thankfully I have the ability to contact them after the fact if there is something I didn't have fully explained while at an appointment.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Typically when I see a doctor, they are a medical resident. I actually feel more confident in this situation because I know that if there is any doubt, they will seek more information through their attending. I would say I usually trust the doctors I see, but I do like to keep myself informed by other means as well, just in case.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The thing that makes me most anxious is wondering if there will be something majorly wrong. I also worry that there won't be anything that can be done for symptoms that may be present.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I studied athletic training in college, and I've found that useful in emergent situations throughout life. If someone falls and cuts themselves or breaks something, I am confident enough to do what needs to be done immediately and then decide if they need to seek further medical attention. I recently helped an older gentleman who had tripped, fallen, and split his head. I knew to limit mobility until help arrived, and I knew to watch for signs of concussion (i.e. vomiting, blackout). I was able to help limit the loss of blood while we waited for the ambulance and kept him comfortable.

I don't have a regular doctor's but the doctor's I've been to has be really trusting.They all ways tell me what I need to know.

That where might be something wrong with me that can't me helped with medication. That I will have to have surgery and I don't have money for all of that.

When I'm feeling sick with a similar symptom that l had in the past I know exactly what it is my knowledge from the doctors.

i trust me primary care physician because they provide my health information and perscribe my appointments.

i would feel anxious if  my doctor was not worried about my appointment  and didnt show up on time. i have noticed that he is on time.

i always looked up the information about health issues in my computer and have always been able to find the information i needed on time.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I think I have a good ability to make health decisions because I am able to read and understand medical information, as long as it is geared towards the general public. I am generally confident in asking questions of providers if I'm unsure. I have a good grasp of English and try to be prepared to get information when I see a doctor.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I generally trust doctors because it is in their interest to make people feel better, and they have the training to do that. I think it takes a lot of caring for others to be a doctor and most physicians have the patient's best interests at heart. Most of them are proud of what they do and want to do well.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I worry about all the things that could be wrong with me that I didn't notice, but the doctor might find out. These might be expensive to fix, or embarassing, or something that I was foolish not to notice on my own. I might not be in as good of health as I had thought.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I received a spider bite from an unknown spider, I knew that I should keep an eye on the bite in case it became serious. I drew a circle around the bite and watched to see if it became bigger. When it did, I went to the doctor and got treatment. I had an infection that was easily treatable.

I feel basic medical information is easy to process, unless it is something that you are not aware of. Say for instance your blood pressure is up, you ask why and the answer is.. could be a number of things.. and that's it. I understand it is general, but sometimes the answers do not help at all.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I guess it is I trust my doctor to make decisions and help find answers. It is the unexplained sickness or pain that seems like all doctors avoid. You always have to see several doctors instead of just a few and that's when it seems like your being pushed through the system. If someone finds something, or another test is run.. I want to know why.. and what the findings are. Some don't let you know anything after tests are done.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I think it is just the unexpected. I'm ok as long as I know what is going to happen, but if I don't .. then I get anxious - confused - nervous and sometimes upset.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I am pretty familiar with medical terminology and how things work.  I am able to successfully google any information I don't know.  I never just take a doctor on their word and do ask questions and do my own research.  Doctors are not always right, whether they are new, stuck in a prescribing rut or have chosen not to be reeducated on current practices for a particular symptom/illness.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
She listens well and I never seem rushed.  She is willing to answer questions and look up information if I ask something specific.  She is persoble and warm.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am usually not very anxious about going and seeing a doctor.  Seeing a new doctor for the first time always makes me anxious or if I'm worried about my current symptoms and her diagnosis but generally, I'm not anxious about seeing my current doctor when I need to.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Twice in my life, my doctors have put me on medications that were bad for me.  One, I was trying to get pregnt and she told me Accupril would be safe for that.  I had asked her at least a dozen times.  I found out that was not true and stopped the meds and a month later got pregnt. The other time I was given lisinopril and told it would protect my kidneys.  My kidney function basically tanked over the next 9 months going from 99% to 43%. I did some research and found out other people were experiencing the same thing.  I stopped the drug on my own again and in 6 months my rel function was back up to 80%.
